De plus le service n’est pas digne d’un 4* : des verres proposés mais pas de bouteille d’eau ce qui est le minimum requis. Pour réussir à dormir, j’ai du mettre un t-shirt sur l’oreiller tellement qu’il était chargé de poussière. Je vous déconseille cet hôtel pour la vétusté des chambres. Sinon le personnel essaye de faire le nécessaire avec le peu de moyens mis à disposition. Cher pour ce que c’est (110€/nuit en septembre.
translated_review_text: For asmathics like me, I do not recommend this hotel. It has the distinction of having carpets in the rooms and what is more systematically cleaned. In addition, the service is not worthy of a 4*: glasses offered but no water bottle which is the minimum required. To succeed in sleeping, I had to put a t-shirt on the pillow so much that he was loaded with dust. I do not recommend this hotel for the dilapidation of the rooms. Otherwise the staff try to do the necessary with the few means made available. Expensive for what it is (110 €/night in September.

On arrive dans la chambre il ya juste un cap de bain pour une seule personne alors que nous sommes uj couples avec un bébé. Je ne trouve pas de lit bébé dans la chambre, alors je décent gentiment à l'accueil pour demander le lit bébé, elle me répond que ca va venir dici ce soir... Et elle me dit aussi que je peu faire une réclamation en cas où je ne reçois pas le lit bébé avec un regard mal poli.
A la fin du séjour je rend les clés même pas un mot ou un regard. Franchement elle ne mérite pas la place de l'accueil.
Petit déjeuner très moyen. Table sale.

Je recommande pas cet hôtel, malheureusement il y a pas beaucoup de choix à bizerte.

And she also tells me that I can make a complaint in case I do not receive the baby bed with a poorly polished look.
At the end of the stay I make the keys not even a word or a look. Frankly, she does not deserve the place of the reception.
Very average breakfast. Dirty table. 
Clean room but too much noise at night in the corridors and a lot of street noise ...
I do not recommend this hotel, unfortunately there are not much choice in Bizerte.

review_text:
Propre et bien situé, un hôtel qui mériterait un équipement plus écologique car situé en bord de mer.
Salles fonctionnelles et personnel discret, je garde un très bon souvenir! Très bonne cuisine se rapprochant de la cuisine locale! et produits frais locaux!

Clean and well located, a hotel that deserves more ecological equipment because it is located by the sea.

review_text:
We booked a triple room. When we got there, an extra bed was in place but with no sheets and only one big towel for the 3 of us. We told the reception but then had to remind them a further 2 times for anything to get done. When the sheets finally arrived, they handed them to us and left. They didn't even try to make the bed. 

In the morning, when we woke up, our bags were covered in ants. We dusted the ants off and when we told the reception, they just asked us why we didn't tell them earlier because we could have switched rooms. We told them that there were only 1-2 ants around the room the previous night (which we thought was normal for a warm country - so we didn't think to mention it)Then they suggested that it could have been our fault if we were carrying food (we weren't).

If it had been one of the above issues, it would have been alright but combined, it was a terrible experience. We asked for a refund. They offered us half the money back, on the condition that we don't write any negative reviews online! Unbelievable!

review_text:
At first glance, the Bizerta Resort seems ok. The reception area, the grounds outside, the beach access, the nice outdoors pool and the heated indoors pool all give the illusion that it's a proper hotel. Even the rooms are spacious. But that is where the positive aspects end. The sink does not drain, the toilet does not flush, the bathroom is depressing, the food is terrible, the breakfast is basic and service is virtually absent. If you've got an ocean view room, make sure you're on the third floor otherwise you risk seeing more concrete structures than ocean from the balcony.

We were there for a conference and the meeting room was nicely located and very well heated. But it's not a place where I would choose to come for a holiday, as you spend most of your time stressing because the basics don't work.

Pas de Wifi dans la chambre que j'occupais, aucune assistance de la réception qui ne semblait pas concernée

Buffet petit déjeuner triste et sans intérêt

Séjour pour affaires en LPD d'un Week-end fin de l'été.

Points forts :
Chambres spacieuses. TV avec des chaînes française avec une image de très bonne qualité. Tf1, Fr2, Fr3, M6, France 24.
Bureau dans la chambre. Longue piscine profonde (pour les sportifs). Petite salle de musculation. Bonne qualité de massage et soins. Le petit déjeuner est sympathique. Personnel sympathique.

Point à améliorer :
La moquette dans les chambres mériterait un nettoyage en profondeur ou un remplacement. Le climatiseur de chambre mériterait une petite recharge de gaz pour être plus efficace. Le parking n'est pas fermé par une clôture et portail. La literie et la décoration mériteraient un relooking. (Années 80/90).

Dans l'ensemble l'hôtel est entretenu et correcte. La ville est très sympathique surtout le quartier du vieux port.

Spacious rooms. TV with French channels with a very good quality image. TF1, FR2, FR3, M6, France 24.
Office in the room. Long deep swimming pool (for athletes). Small bodybuilding room. Good quality of massage and care. Breakfast is friendly. Friendly staff.

Point to improve:
The carpet in the rooms deserves to be thoroughly deserves or replacement. The chamber air conditioner deserves a small gas recharge to be more effective. The parking lot is not closed by a fence and gate. Bedding and decoration deserve a makeover. (80s and 90s).

Overall the hotel is maintained and correct. The city is very friendly especially the district of Old Port.

review_text: We stayed there for two nights. The place looks overall ok, like a true resort. We payed 110 euros per night (55 euros per person, not sure why they count per person...). Quite a sum for Tunisia and from there one is tempted to judge everything based on rather high standards. And that s when one gets often disappointed, though not always. The room was nice with sea view and lots of light. Hotel itself looks old, like it hasn't been maintained since the 80s. One can feel that these are hard times for tourism and that money is scarce. Hotel seems understaffed. Staff are very nice, though better service would be expected for this kind of hotel. Alcohol is served and the bar looks old and empty and atmosphere rather sad. Two swimming pools - outdoor and indoor - though outdoor was not open yet. Outside the badly needs maintenance.  Breakfast was included but was simply of  horrible quality. Internet worked bad.  So overall OK but not worth the price really.

L'emplacement de l'hôtel est excellent, d'ailleurs c'est le premier à trouver sur votre chemin en arrivant à la ville.
Tout près de la médina de Bizerte et du vieux port mais surtout au bord de la mer.
Les chambres qui donnent sur la mer et la grande piscine sont dotées d'une très belle vue, les autres qui donnent sur les immeubles n'offrent rien de spécial en terme de vue et leurs grandes terrasses ne servent qu'à bronzer vu qu'elles accueillent beaucoup de soleil. Et même si ces chambres donnent sur la rue elles ne sont pas bruyantes c'est bien isolé.
La Piscine couverte est souvent pleine car accessible même aux non résidents.
Le restaurant est moyen et la bouffe n'est pas fameuse en terme de goût et de variété.
Les coussins, couvertures et moquettes ne sont pas très propres. On peut trouver des traces sur les coussins ou des miettes sur les moquettes alors qu'on vient de nettoyer la chambre. 
Les WC et salle de bain dans les chambres ou ailleurs dans l'hôtel sont toujours propres et bien entretenus. De même pour tout ce qui est serviette de bain.
translated_review_text:
The location of the hotel is excellent, moreover it is the first to find on your way when arriving in the city.
Very close to the medina of Bizerte and the old port but especially by the sea.
The rooms which overlook the sea and the large swimming pool have a very beautiful view, the others which give on the buildings offer nothing special in terms of view and their large terraces are used only to sunbathe since they welcome a lot of sun. And even if these rooms overlook the street they are not noisy it is well isolated.
The indoor swimming pool is often full because they are accessible even to non -residents.
The restaurant is average and the food is not famous in terms of taste and variety.
The cushions, covers and carpets are not very clean. You can find traces on the cushions or crumbs on the carpets when we have just cleaned the room. 
WCs and bathrooms in the rooms or elsewhere in the hotel are always clean and well maintained. Likewise for everything that is a bath towel.

many things (such like toilet flushes, balcony lamp,...) miss maintenances, like this hotel is not maintained at all and slowly collapsing...

review_text:
Je viens de passer deux jours à Bizerta resort durant le mois de juillet 2014. L’hôtel est très bien situé, facile d’accès, a un parking  et il a un accès direct à une plage très propre et pas très fréquentée. Malgré l'annulation de derniere minute d'une des chambre réservée, on ne m'a rien fait payer aussi comme j'avais avec moi un tout petit bébé, on m' a donné accès à la chambre deux heures avant l'heure du check in. Toujours avec le sourire en plus.
La bonne impression que j'ai eu en arrivant a duré tout le séjour ou femme de chambre, porteur, serveur au restaurant ou au snake bar , tous ont été d'un professionnalisme irréprochable et d'une grande gentillesse et flexibilité. Ce professionnalise et gentillesse font oublier quelques marques de vieillesse que commence à prendre l'hotel qui commence à avoir besoin d'un petit coup de neuf.
La nourriture au dîner comme au petit déjeuner est diversifiée et bonne ( surtout la pâtisserie) cependant pas tout à fait digne d'un cinq étoiles mais plutôt de quatre étoiles. Cependant chacun finit toujours par trouver un plat à son gout.

 La mer en face de l’hôtel est magnifique mais il s'agit d'une plage publique pas trop fréquentée. La vue à partir de la chambre est juste magnifique.
Enfin un très bon rapport qualité/prix.
Je reviendrai volontiers
translated_review_text:
I just spent two days in Bizerta Resort during the month of July 2014. The hotel is very well located, easy to access, has a parking lot and it has direct access to a very clean and not very busy beach. Despite the cancellation of the last minute of one of the reserved rooms, I was not paid for anything also like I had a very small baby with me, I was given access to the room two hours before check in. Always with a smile in addition.
The good impression I had when I arrived lasted the whole stay or maid, carrier, server at the restaurant or the snake bar, all were of impeccable professionalism and very kindness and flexibility. This professionalism and kindness make you forget some brands of old age that the hotel is starting to take which is starting to need a little new stroke.
Dinner and breakfast food is diversified and good (especially pastry) however not quite worthy of a five -star but rather four stars. However, everyone always ends up finding a dish for their taste.

 The sea in front of the hotel is magnificent but it is a public beach not too busy. The view from the room is just magnificent.
Finally a very good value for money.
I will gladly come back

review_text: Très bon hôtel bien situé, j'y suis aller il y a 5 ans j'avais même le droit d'aller dans le jacouzzi alors que je n'avait pas encore l'âge ! Très belle piscine, bien entretenue . Ma chambre était avec vue sur mer et elle était bien éclairée. Il y a même un salon de coiffure à proximité ! Le personnel était agréable . Je compte y retourner cet été !
translated_review_text: Very good hotel well located, I went there 5 years ago I was even allowed to go to Jacouzzi when I was not yet the age! Very nice swimming pool, well maintained. My room was with sea view and it was well lit. There is even a nearby hair salon! The staff were pleasant. I plan to go back this summer!

review_text:

review_text: Ho soggiornato più volte per motivi di lavoro; per essere un 4 stelle, mi sembra un po' esagerato; di resort ha ben poco, è più un albergo utile per motivi di lavoro che di vacanza; discreta la pulizia, scarsi i servizi, discreta la colazione (non proprio ricca), sufficiente il menù del ristorante; considerando il posto geografico, forse il tutto è accettabile; il prezzo giornaliero del soggiorno e del ristorante  però è eccessivo per gli std tunisini, ma lì di meglio c'è ben poco.
translated_review_text: I have stayed several times for work reasons; To be a 4 star, it seems a little exaggerated to me; It is very little of resorts, it is more a hotel useful for work reasons than holiday; Discreet cleaning, the services are scarce, discreet breakfast (not really rich), the restaurant menu is sufficient; Considering the geographical place, perhaps everything is acceptable; The daily price of the stay and the restaurant, however, is excessive for the Tunisian stds, but there is very little better there.

review_text:
Provato durante un viaggio di lavoro ad inizio Dicembre il "Resort" si conferma un buon albergo dove passare le notti fra una giornata di lavoro ed un altra. Personalmente non passerei le vacanze qui ma sicuramente nel panorama alberghiero di Bizerte è qualche gradino più in su.
Camere piacevoli, riscaldamento adeguato (mica una garanzia in Tunisia) e bagno grande con doccia calda e forte.
Peccato il promesso wi-fi gratuito con campo scarsissimo e che spesso dalle 20:00 in avanti non funziona fino al mattino dopo. Visto i costi delle chiamate dalla Tunisia all'Italia (3,00€ minuti con Vodafone) è una mancanza pesante.
Colazione internazionale semplice ma buona, caffè da evitare, meglio the o Nescafè. 
Al check out regolarmente non riconoscono i voucher di viaggio dicendo che le carte di credito fornite dalla agenzie viaggi non sono valide. Un classico. Con qualche battibecco e alche telefonata in agenzia si risolve. Che barba però!
translated_review_text:
Tested during a business trip at the beginning of December the "resort" is confirmed as a good hotel to spend the nights between one day of work and another. Personally I would not spend the holidays here but surely in the hotels of Bizerta's hotel it is a few more ups and on top.
Pleasant rooms, adequate heating (not a warranty in Tunisia) and a large bathroom with hot and strong shower.
Too bad the promised free Wi-Fi with very low field and which often does not work from 20:00 on the next morning. Given the costs of calls from Tunisia to Italy (€ 3.00 minutes with Vodafone) is a heavy lack.
Simple but good international breakfast, coffee to avoid, better The or Nescafè. 
At check out they do not recognize travel vouchers by saying that the credit cards provided by the travel agencies are not valid. A classic. With some bickering and alche phone calls to the agency it is resolved. What a beard though!

review_text: Lo definirei più un grande albergone sul mare che un resort. Un po' stile anni '70. Comunque pratico per chi è di passaggio e per una notte solamente. Le camere sono funzionali, e la nostra aveva la vista mare. Personale gentile. Colazione buona. Un po' fuori prezzo. Mi è difficile capire chi possa soggiornare qui per trascorrere le sue vacanze.
translated_review_text: I would call it more a large hotel on the sea than a resort. A little 70s style. However practical for those who are passing through and for one night only. The rooms are functional, and ours had sea view. Kind staff. Good breakfast. A little out of price. It is difficult for me to understand who can stay here to spend his holidays.

The hotel that wants to be Palace is undoubtedly on a more glorious past, but remains very well maintained. Obviously European standards are not there, but it is a very well kept and maintained establishment. 

The rooms are spacious with good quality wifi access. The room I had given on the sea, a treat when I wake up with sunrise and during the night when I was rocked by the sound of the waves. The view is a little less delightful with beyond the limit of the hotel a view that looks more like a vacant lot ...  

I have not tested the my host restaurant for this stay preferring to take me to a nearby fish restaurant. I did not test breakfast either.

We booked with booking.com and the hotel refused to honour the price we booked at. The lady cashier argued for 20 minutes, at check out, before giving up and was bad tempered throughout. She was good at arguing in English though.

Internet connection was difficult. They say they change the pass codes daily but on the first day it only worked for about 1/2 hour and on our 2nd day we had to get 3 codes from reception before we got one that worked.

We went out to eat dinner in town south of the kasbah. We had good cheap meals and found the locals to be helpful and very friendly even while their countrymen were demonstrating at the US embassy in Tunis.

.

L'hôtel est pas mal, c'est calme on y dort bien et c'est un bon point de départ pour vadrouiller dans la région. J'y avais séjourné il y a deux ou trois ans et on avait bien aimé.
Sauf que cette fois ci un phénomène inattendu nous y "attendait": le directeur...à la santé mentale un peu douteuse... He gave me a lesson on the check in the hotels because I wanted to have the room at 1 p.m. telling myself that it was not possible at 3 p.m. and that 1 was his law that applied and that he knew everything better than I had white hair (the check in the website Reservation) ... We took 2 bedrooms and a suite, but we could not raise any visitor in the suite !!! And then he wanted to get everyone out of the swimming pool at 6 p.m. In short, a very amazing behavior, he takes himself for a general supervisor except that for my part I will not take any more at this hotel as long as he is there ...

review_text:
Voyageant plusieurs fois par an en Tunisie depuis deux ans, je viens de découvrir un superbe hôtel à Bizerte, le Bizerta Resort, affichant fièrement ses 4 étoiles mais qui mérite amplement d'en avoir une 5ème très rapidement. Vous êtes très aimablement accueilli à la réception par un personnel souriant et d'une très grande efficacité. Les chambres sont très spacieuses, joliment décorées, avec goût, et très bien équipées y compris avec la wifi dans tout l'hôtel incluant les chambres. Pour ceux qui aiment regarder la télévision, l'hôtel offre une grande quantité de chaînes arabes, internationales et françaises comme France 2, TF1, M6 etc.
Les femmes de chambres sont aussi très aimables et assurent un service d'une très grande propreté, toujours avec le sourire. La salle de bain bénéficie de tous les équipements modernes et en parfait état.
Bien climatisée, la chambre est dotée également d'un balcon de dimension très convenable.
Globalement, le personnel n'est pas avare de renseignements et se met à votre entière disposition pour vous satisfaire.
Pour l'avoir testé durant plusieurs jours, le petit-déjeuner buffet offre un choix important de pains, de viennoiseries et de cakes ; trois sortes de fromages sont offerts à côté de plats chauds incluant les œufs et des spécialités tunisiennes. Bon choix de yaourts également et de fruits frais de saison.
Cet hôtel est d'un excellent rapport-qualité prix. Je peux en témoigner facilement, moi qui voyage dans le monde entier en ma qualité de journaliste. La publicité l'annonce comme un hôtel d'affaires. Certes, mais il peut aussi très bien convenir pour des vacances agréables en famille. La piscine est de belle dimension et le maître-nageur très aimable. Vous pouvez vous restaurer en été au snack près de la piscine pour ceux qui aiment le farniente toute la journée.
Un spa est également annoncé, je n'ai pas eu le loisir de le tester mais il semble tout à fait convenable.
Autre point non négligeable, l'hôtel est bien située à Bizerte, à équidistance du port, du centre-ville et de la corniche.
Si vous souhaitez découvrir Bizerte, ses petits restos sympas, ses poissons, ses terrasses, une bonne adresse où loger, sans hésitation : le BIZERTA RESORT ! Vous ne serez pas déçus ! Vous avez ma parole !
translated_review_text:
Traveling several times a year in Tunisia for two years, I have just discovered a superb hotel in Bizerte, the Bizerta Resort, proudly displaying its 4 stars but which deserves to have a 5th very quickly. You are very kindly welcomed at the reception by a smiling staff and very efficient. The rooms are very spacious, nicely decorated, tastefully, and very well equipped, including with the WiFi throughout the hotel including the rooms. For those who like to watch television, the hotel offers a large amount of Arab, international and French channels like France 2, TF1, M6 etc.
The women of rooms are also very friendly and provide a very cleaning service, always with a smile. The bathroom benefits from all modern equipment and in perfect condition.
Well air conditioned, the room also has a very suitable balcony of dimension.
Overall, the staff are not stingy with information and puts themselves at your entire disposal to satisfy you.
For having tested it for several days, the buffet breakfast offers a significant choice of breads, pastries and cakes; Three kinds of cheeses are offered next to hot dishes including eggs and Tunisian specialties. Good choice of yogurts also and fresh seasonal fruit.

review_text: Bizerta Resort Hotel, produit de luxe en Tunisie, au bord d'une large plage de sable fin doré... L'été, un hôtel balnéaire animé proposant des animations variées telles que "cabaret show, bingo, billards"... sans oublier les soirées à thème "soirée folklorique, spectacles de variétés". Voilà tel que décrit dans sa brochure, cet hôtel le plus "prestigieux" de la région. Par "l'odeur alléchés" nous nous sommes offerts quelques semaines dans cet "eldorado" de rêve. Mais, tel le corbeau, nous nous sommes laissés prendre par le renard. La large plage de sable fin doré n'est, dans la réalité, qu'une immense poubelle où fleurissent, pêle mêle, sacs plastiques, couches usagées, canettes vides et... toutes sortes de détritus ni fins ni dorés. L'animation balnéaire est assurée, dans la journée par l'intrusion, à la piscine, tous les après-midi de jeunes émanant des cités de la banlieue parisienne qui, moyennant subsides sont autorisés à utiliser les services de la piscine et du snack bar attenant, avec vente d'alcool, rendant le lieu infréquentable pour les résidents de l'hôtel. Si ce même endroit n'est pas "public" le matin, il est, néanmoins, difficile d'y trouver un transat dont le matelas ne soit pas sale ou poisseux, résultat de leurs bataillent à coups de Coca Cola ou autres breuvages. L'hôtel prouve, ainsi, son désintérêt pour le bien être de ses résidents et son intérêt pour la manne apportée par cette population extérieure. Pour ce qui est des animations nocturnes, nous n'avons pas du suffisamment chercher. Peut être est-ce, ce malheureux musicien installé, à l'écart, au bord d'une piscine désertée et qui n'anime... rien ? Point de "bingo, spectacle de variétés". En revanche, l'hôtel toujours en quête de revenus, accueille quasi quotidiennement des mariages qui, vers 22h vous "régalent" de leurs "you you" au son des tambourins. Ce qui, si vous êtes chanceux, vous laissera vous endormir vers 1h du matin. Mais peut être qu'une partie de billard vous ferait plaisir ? Eh bien non ! Raté ! Les deux sont en panne. Dommage. Soirée ratée. Car la ville à l'image de l'hôtel n'a rien à offrir le soir. Allons nous pouvoir nous consoler devant une bonne table ? Là encore... déception. Au petit déjeuner, sous forme de buffet, vous trouverez des jus de fruits coupés d'eau, du pain dur, des oeufs durs et quelques charcuteries locales. Ce n'est pas lui qui vous fera grossir. Allons donc déjeuner au snack piscine où un personnel revèche vous "accueille". Le sourire est réservé à la clientèle locale. Si vous comptez y déjeuner plusieurs jours consécutifs il est conseillé d'avoir un goût prononcé pour les pizzas et les pâtes... pizzas toujours bien fines parfois recouvertes de mozzarela tunisienne rance. Heureusement il y a le dîner... Là c'est variable, plutôt moins mauvais certains soirs. Là encore c'est la formule buffet qui l'emporte. Au niveau repas en général, la spécialité du lieu consiste à essayer de vous "fourger" ce que vous n'avez pas choisi. Vous avez bien dit glace vanille-chocolat... Eh bien vous mangerez une vanille-pistache. Vous demandez un rosé "gris de Tunisie", c'est un "Saint Augustin" au double de prix que l'on vous apporte. Et tout est à l'avenant. En résumé : vous avez de l'argent à gaspiller, une furieuse envie de vous ennuyer, cet hôtel "prestigieux" vous accueillera pour des vacances inoubliables. Nous ne parlerons pas de la froideur du directeur qui n'incite pas aux commentaires. Rassurez vous, il existe bien en Tunisie des hôtels de qualité. Mais pas le Bizerta Resort, du moins, au niveau du tourisme.
translated_review_text: Bizerta Resort Hotel, luxury product in Tunisia, on the edge of a wide golden sandy beach ... In summer, a lively seaside hotel offering various entertainment such as "Cabaret Show, Bingo, Billards" ... without forgetting the theme evenings "folk evening, varieties' shows. This is as described in its brochure, this most "prestigious" hotel in the region. By "L'Obor Lécés" we offered ourselves a few weeks in this dream "Eldorado". But, like the crow, we let ourselves be taken by the fox. The wide golden sandy beach is only a huge bin in reality in which blooms, pells mix, plastic bags, used layers, empty cans and ... all kinds of nor fine nor gold. The seaside animation is ensured, during the day by the intrusion, at the swimming pool, every afternoon of young people emanating from the cities of the Parisian suburbs which, for subsidies are authorized to use the services of the swimming pool and the adjoining snack bar, with the sale of alcohol, making the place infrequent for the residents of the hotel. If this same place is not "public" in the morning, it is, however, difficult to find a deckchair whose mattress is not dirty or sticky, the result of their battles with cola coca or other beverages. The hotel thus proves its disinterest in the well -being of its residents and its interest in the windfall brought by this external population. As for night animations, we did not have enough to look for. Maybe it is, this unfortunate musician installed, away, by a deserted swimming pool and who drives ... nothing? Point of "bingo, variety show". On the other hand, the hotel still in search of income, welcomes almost daily weddings which, around 10 p.m. you "delight" from their "you you" to the sound of drums. Which, if you are lucky, will let you fall asleep around 1 a.m. But maybe a part of billiards would make you happy? Well no! Failed! Both are broken. Damage. Failed evening. Because the city like the hotel has nothing to offer in the evening. Are we going to be able to console ourselves in front of a good table? Again ... disappointment. At breakfast, in the form of a buffet, you will find fruit juices cut off from water, hard bread, hard eggs and some local cold meats. It is not he who will make you fat. So let's go to lunch at the snack swimming pool where a reviewed staff "welcomes" you. The smile is reserved for local customers. If you plan to have lunch there for several consecutive days it is advisable to have a pronounced taste for pizzas and pasta ... Pizzas always very fine sometimes covered with Tunisian Mozzarela Rance. Fortunately there is dinner ... There it is variable, rather less bad certain evenings. Here again it is the buffet formula that wins. At the meal level in general, the specialty of the place is to try to "turn" you what you have not chosen. You said Vanilla-Chocolate ice cream ... Well you will eat a vanilla-spout. You ask for a "gray from Tunisia" rosé, it is a "Saint Augustine" with a double price that we bring you. And everything is amendment. In summary: you have money to waste, a furious desire to get bored, this "prestigious" hotel will welcome you for an unforgettable vacation. We will not talk about the coldness of the director who does not encourage comments. Rest assured, there are quality hotels in Tunisia. But not the Bizerta Resort, at least, in terms of tourism.

Mais en rentrant du petit déjeuner nous avons eu la surprise de retrouver notre chambre sans le papier ne pas déranger sur la poignée que nous avions laissé. Au début un peu contrariée (sachant qu'on avait laissé traîné nos affaire partout), c'est au final pour découvrir que le personnel de chambre nous préparaient une petite surprise. Des fleurs déposés sur le lit, des pliages de serviettes en cœur et autres décorations d'amoureux. Très attentionné de leurs part et finalement contente de l'initiative. 👍 Je joins les photos.
translated_review_text: I do not know if it is to our second visit to the hotel between other excursions in Tunisia, or to the tip left to the room staff the last time. At the beginning a little upset (knowing that we had left our business dragged everywhere), it was in the end to discover that the room staff were preparing a little surprise. Flowers placed on the bed, folds of towels in the heart and other decorations of lovers. Very attentive to them and finally happy with the initiative. 👍 I join the photos.
